He formally launched his campaign on August 13, 2011, in [[Charleston, South Carolina]].{{cite news |first=Ashley |last=Parker |work=[[The New York Times]] |title=Promising Better Direction, Perry Enters Race |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/14/us/politics/14perry.html |date=August 13, 2011 |accessdate=January 11, 2012}} While he was initially successful in fundraising and was briefly considered a serious contender for the nomination, he struggled during the debates and his poll numbers began to decline. After finishing fifth with just over 10% of the vote in the [[Iowa caucuses]] on January 3, 2012, Perry considered dropping out of the presidential race but did not.{{cite news |first=John |last=Whitesides |publisher=Reuters |title=Perry may drop presidential bid after Iowa |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/01/04/us-usa-campaign-perry-idUSTRE8020LC20120104 |date=January 4, 2012 |accessdate=January 11, 2012}}{{cite news |first=Michael A. |last=Memoli |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |title=Rick Perry suspending campaign after disappointing finish in Iowa caucuses |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/politics/la-pn-rick-perry-suspend-campaign-20120103,0,7870108.story |date=January 3, 2012 |accessdate=January 1, 2012}} After a poor showing in New Hampshire and with "lagging" poll numbers in South Carolina, Perry formally announced he was suspending his campaign on January 19, 2012.{{Cite news |first1=Jeff |last1=Zeleny |first2=Michael D. |last2=Shear |work=The Caucus |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]'' |title=Perry to End Bid for Presidency |url=http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/01/19/perry-to-end-bid-for-presidency/ |date=January 19, 2012 |accessdate=January 19, 2012}} ==2016 presidential campaign== {{Main|Rick Perry presidential campaign, 2016}} [[File:Former Texas Governor Rick Perry speaking at 2015 FITN (First in the Nation) Republican Leadership Summit in New Hampshire.jpg|thumb|180px|Rick Perry speaking at 2015 First in the Nation Republican Leadership Summit in [[New Hampshire]]]] Almost immediately following the 2012 election, Perry was mentioned as a potential candidate for the presidency in the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 presidential election]], with a ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine article in July 2013 saying that "everything is aligned for Rick Perry to be the Republican nominee for president in 2016."{{cite news|last1=Miller|first1=Zeke|title=Can Anyone Stop Rick Perry In 2016?|url=http://swampland.time.com/2013/07/09/can-anyone-stop-rick-perry-in-2016/|accessdate=May 16, 2015|publisher=Time|date=July 9, 2013}} Perry officially launched his 2016 presidential candidacy on June 4, 2015, in [[Addison, Texas]]. A version of the [[Colt Ford]] song "Answer To No One" boomed from loudspeakers, as Perry took to the stage.Katz, Celeste. [http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/rick-perry-announce-2016-presidential-bid-thurs-aid-article-1.2246081 Former Texas Gov. Rick Perry announces 2016 presidential bid], ''[[New York Daily News]]'' (June 4, 2015).Paulson, Dave. [http://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2015/06/05/rick-perrys-country-rap-song-comes-nashville/28536777/ Rick Perry's country-rap song comes from Nashville], ''[[The Tennessean]]'' (June 5, 2015).{{cite news|title=Rick Perry announces 2016 bid, a re-do from 2012|last=Weissert|first=Will|last2=Peoples|first2=Steve|work = Associated Press|accessdate=June 4, 2015|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/8e05a812781f4a26a1641086b2365b11/humbler-rick-perry-hopes-2016-bid-goes-better-first}}{{cite news|title=Rick Perry launches comeback bid for White House|last=Bradner|first=Eric|work=CNN|accessdate=June 4, 2015|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/06/04/politics/rick-perry-2016-presidential-announcement/index.html}}{{cite web|title=Rick Perry launches 2016 presidential campaign|last=Camia|first=Catalina|last2=Jervis|first2=Rick|work=USA TODAY|accessdate=June 4, 2015|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2015/06/04/rick-perry-president-2016-campaign/23842295}} He then announced his candidacy at the scheduled press conference.{{cite news|url=http://time.com/3909057/rick-perry-2016-campaign-launch|title=Rick Perry Announces Presidential Bid|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=June 4, 2015|accessdate=June 4, 2015|author1=Beckwith, Ryan Teague|author2=Rhodan, Maya}} Perry withdrew on September 11, 2015—becoming the first in the field of major candidates to drop out—following poor polling after the first debate.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/09/11/politics/rick-perry-2016-campaign-suspended/index.html|title=Rick Perry drops out of 2016 presidential race − CNNPolitics.com|author=Theodore Schleifer, CNN|date=September 11, 2015|work=CNN|accessdate=September 13, 2015}} In the weeks before he dropped out of the race, Perry's campaign was in dire financial straits, spending nearly four times as much as it raised.Patrick Svitek, [http://www.texastribune.org/2015/10/15/records-perry-campaign-bled-cash-final-weeks/ Records: Perry Campaign Bled Cash in Final Weeks], ''Texas Tribune'', October 15, 2015. On January 25, 2016, Perry endorsed United States Senator [[Ted Cruz]] (R-TX) for president.{{cite news |url=http://www.politico.com/story/2016/01/rick-perry-endorses-ted-cruz-218170|title=Rick Perry endorses Ted Cruz − politico.com|author=Katie Glueck, Politico|date=January 25, 2016|work=Politico|accessdate=January 25, 2016}} On May 5, 2016, following the suspension of Cruz's presidential campaign, Perry endorsed [[Donald Trump]] for the presidency.{{cite news|last1=Svitek|first1=Patrick|title=Rick Perry on Trump Endorsement: "We Let Bygones be Bygones"|url=https://www.texastribune.org/2016/05/06/perry-defends-trump-endorsement/|accessdate=13 June 2017|publisher=Texas Tribune|date=May 6, 2016}} ==Secretary of Energy== [[File:Secretary Rick Perry at 2017 Energy Project Management Awards.jpg|thumb|right|180px|Secretary Perry at the 2017 Energy Project Management Awards on March 22, 2017]] On December 12, 2016, multiple sources reported that Perry would be nominated by Trump to serve as [[United States Secretary of Energy|Secretary]] of the [[United States Department of Energy]].{{cite web|url= http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/politics-government/article120542558.html |title=Rick Perry tapped to be energy secretary under Donald Trump, reports say|publisher=}}{{cite web|url= http://www.cbsnews.com/news/donald-trump-rick-perry-energy-secretary/ |title=Major Garrett: Donald Trump chooses Rick Perry to be energy secretary|publisher=}} On December 14, 2016, it was officially announced that Perry would be nominated as Secretary of Energy by President-elect [[Donald Trump]].{{cite web |url=https://greatagain.gov/president-elect-trump-to-nominate-rick-perry-as-energy-secretary-bf296f20b867 |title=President-Elect Donald J. Trump Intends toe Former Texas Governor Rick Perry as Secretary of the U.S. Department of Energy |publisher=GreatAgain.gov |accessdate=December 14, 2016 |date=December 14, 2016 |author=The Trump-Pence Transition Team}} He was heavily criticized when he was first nominated because, during a previous presidential campaign, Perry (after briefly forgetting which of the three departments he wanted to eliminate) said he intended to abolish the department.{{cite web|url= https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2016/12/rick-perry-energy-secretary-trump/510506/ |title=Will Rick Perry Promote Science at the Department of Energy?|website=The Atlantic|date=December 14, 2016}} His nomination was approved by a 16–7 vote from the [[United States Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources]] on January 31, 2017.{{cite web|last=Wolfgang|first=Ben|url= http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/jan/31/rick-perry-ryan-zinke-clear-senate-committee-bipar/ |title=Rick Perry, Ryan Zinke clear Senate committee with bipartisan support|work=[[The Washington Times]]|date=January 31, 2017|accessdate=January 31, 2017}} On March 2, 2017, Perry was confirmed by the United States Senate in a 62–37 vote. In April 2017, Perry ordered a study of the [[Continental U.S. power transmission grid|U.S. electric grid]] with particular consideration to [[Coal power in the United States|coal power]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-04-15/electric-grid-study-ordered-by-u-s-energy-chief-to-boost-coal |title=Electric Grid Study Ordered by U.S. Energy Chief to Boost Coal |author=Jennifer A Dlouhy and Jennifer Jacobs |date=April 15, 2017 |website=[[Bloomberg.com]] |access-date=April 17, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://prime-policy.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Energy-Memo.pdf |title=Study Examining Electricity Markets and Reliability |author=Rick Perry |date=April 14, 2017 |publisher=[[United States Department of Energy]] |website=[[Prime Policy Group]] |access-date=May 21, 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170521103019/http://prime-policy.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Energy-Memo.pdf |archivedate=May 21, 2017 |deadurl=no |df=mdy-all }} In a CNBC interview on June 19, 2017, he downplayed the role of human activity in the recent rise of the Earth’s temperature, saying natural causes are likely the main driver of [[climate change]].{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/06/19/energy-sec-rick-perry-says-co2-is-not-the-main-driver-of-climate-change.html|title=Energy Secretary Rick Perry says CO2 is not the main driver of climate change|first=Tom|last=DiChristopher|date=June 19, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=July 11, 2018}} In November 2017, Perry suggested that using fossil fuels to light dangerous places in Africa could reduce sexual assault, saying, "When the lights are on, when you have light that shines the righteousness, if you will, on those types of acts." Perry was criticized by the [[Sierra Club]] for "exploiting the struggle of those most affected by climate change."{{cite web|title=Rick Perry under fire for suggestion fossil fuels can reduce sexual assault|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2017/nov/02/rick-perry-fossil-fuels-sexual-assault|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=3 November 2017}}{{cite web|last1=Dooley|first1=Erin|title=Rick Perry suggests fossil fuels could reduce sexual assault in Africa|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/rick-perry-suggests-fossil-fuels-reduce-sexual-assault/story?id=50891889|publisher=[[ABC News]]|accessdate=3 November 2017}} ==Political future== {{update section|reason=2018 election has come and gone|date=November 2018}} Perry was mentioned as a possible challenger, [[United States Senate election in Texas, 2018|in 2018]], to U.S. Senator and fellow 2016 Republican [[Ted Cruz presidential campaign, 2016|presidential candidate]] [[Ted Cruz]], whom Perry had initially endorsed after suspending his own campaign.{{cite web|last=Barrouquere|first=Brett|title=Ted Cruz eyeing 2020, but must clear Rick Perry, others for re-election|url=http://www.chron.com/news/politics/texas/article/Ted-Cruz-eyeing-2020-but-must-clear-Rick-Perry-9183986.php|work=[[Houston Chronicle]]|date=August 25, 2016|accessdate=August 25, 2016}} Speculation about Cruz being challenged in the Republican primary arose in the wake of the [[2016 Republican National Convention]], when Cruz controversially refused to endorse [[Donald Trump]], the eventual Republican presidential nominee, whom Perry had endorsed after Cruz suspended his campaign.{{cite web|last=Carney|first=Jordain|url=http://thehill.com/blogs/ballot-box/senate-races/292519-trump-rick-perry-would-do-well-against-cruz|title=Trump: Rick Perry would 'do well' against Cruz|work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]|date=August 24, 2016|accessdate=August 25, 2016}} In a poll conducted from August 12 to 14 of that year by ''[[Public Policy Polling]]'', Perry had a 46%–37% lead over Cruz.{{cite web|url=http://www.publicpolicypolling.com/pdf/2015/PPP_Release_TX_81716.pdf|work=[[Public Policy Polling]]|title=Perry leads Cruz, 46%–37%|accessdate=August 25, 2016}} Later that month, Trump stated that he had "been hearing a lot about that, and I don’t know if he wants to do it, but boy, will he do well. People love him in Texas, and he was one great governor." ==Career outside politics== On February 2015, Perry announced that he would join the board of directors of [[Energy Transfer Partners]],{{cite web|url=http://governance.energytransfer.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=106094&p=irol-govBio&ID=243624|title=EnergyTransfer.com – Investor Relations – Biography|publisher=}} which owns and operates one of the largest energy asset portfolios in the United States, and Sunoco Partners, another major Dallas energy company.{{cite web|url=http://ir.energytransfer.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=106094&p=irol-IRHome|title=EnergyTransfer.com – Investor Relations – Investor Relations Home|publisher=}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.dallasnews.com/business/energy/2017/01/05/rick-perry-leaves-board-dallas-based-energy-transfer-partners-confirmation-looming|title=Rick Perry leaves board of Dallas-based Energy Transfer Partners with confirmation looming|date=2017-01-05|work=Dallas News|access-date=2017-08-24|language=en}} According to SEC filings, Perry resigned from the boards of both companies on December 31, 2016. ===''Dancing with the Stars''=== On August 30, 2016, Perry was announced as one of the celebrities who would compete on [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 23)|season 23]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]''. He was partnered with professional dancer [[Emma Slater]].{{cite web|url=https://gma.yahoo.com/dwts-2016-celebrity-cast-revealed-ryan-lochte-amber-123029354--abc-news-tv.html|title=‘DWTS’ 2016 Celebrity Cast Revealed: Ryan Lochte, Amber Rose, Rick Perry Among Star Lineup|work=Good Morning America: Yahoo|accessdate=August 30, 2016}} Perry and Slater were eliminated on the third week of competition and finished in 12th place.{{cite web|url=http://www.buddytv.com/articles/dancing-with-the-stars/dancing-with-the-stars-results-61420.aspx|title='Dancing with the Stars' Results Live Blog: The Second Elimination|work=buddytv.com|date=September 27, 2016|accessdate=September 27, 2016}} ==Books and speeches== Perry has written two books: * ''On My Honor: Why the American Values of the Boy Scouts are Worth Fighting For'' was published in February 2008.{{cite book|last=Perry|first=Rick|title=On My Honor: Why the American Values of the Boy Scouts are Worth Fighting For|publisher=Stroud & Hall|date=February 2008|isbn=978-0-9796462-2-5}} It celebrates the positive impact of the organization on the youth of America and criticizes the [[ACLU]] for its legal actions against the [[Boy Scouts of America]].{{cite news|title=In first book, Perry criticizes ACLU and defends Boy Scouts|url=http://www.statesman.com/news/content/region/legislature/stories/02/09/0209perrybook.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080227234050/http://www.statesman.com/news/content/region/legislature/stories/02/09/0209perrybook.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=February 27, 2008|last=Selby|first=W. Gardner|work=[[Austin American-Statesman]]|date=February 9, 2008|accessdate=June 22, 2008|df=mdy-all}} * ''[[Fed Up! Our Fight to Save America from Washington]]'', was written with senior advisor Chip Roy and published in November 2010.{{cite book|last=Perry|first=Rick|title=Fed Up! Our Fight to Save America from Washington|publisher=Little, Brown|date=November 2010|isbn=978-0-316-13295-4}} It discusses his support for limited federal government. He has given a number of speeches, including one at the [[Heritage Foundation]] on his views of the proper role of the federal government and the military in disaster management.{{cite book|last=Perry|first=Rick|title=Federalizing Disaster Response|publisher=Heritage Foundation|date=November 2005}} ==Personal life== In 1982, Perry married [[Anita Thigpen Perry|Mary Anita Thigpen]], his childhood sweetheart whom he had known since [[elementary school]]. They have two adult children, Griffin and Sydney. Anita attended [[West Texas State University]] and earned a degree in nursing. She has spearheaded a number of health-related initiatives such as the Anita Thigpen Perry Endowment at the [[University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio]], which focuses on nutrition, [[cardiovascular disease]], [[health education]], and early childhood development.{{cite web|url=http://www.uthscsa.edu/opa/issues/new34-24/perry.html|title=Endowment named for First Lady Anita Perry – University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio|publisher=Uthscsa.edu|date=June 15, 2001|accessdate=August 18, 2011}} She helped develop and host the [[Texas Conference for Women]].{{cite web|last=Giles|first=Mike|title=Governor Rick Perry Leads Texas by Faith|url=http://www.dfwchristianfamily.com/cover/Governor-Rick-Perry-Leads-Texas-by-Faith.php|publisher=DFW Christian Family|accessdate=August 22, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111007205513/http://www.dfwchristianfamily.com/cover/Governor-Rick-Perry-Leads-Texas-by-Faith.php|archivedate=October 7, 2011|df=mdy-all}} Perry played himself in minor roles for several feature films, including ''[[Man of the House (2005 film)|Man of the House]]'', ''Deep in the Heart'', and ''[[Hating Breitbart]]''.{{cite web|title=Rick Perry|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1752773/|publisher=IMDb|accessdate=13 June 2017}} In 2001, the [[American Cowboy Culture Association]], based in [[Lubbock]], handed Perry its "The Top Cowboy of Texas" award. In accepting the honor, Perry cited the importance of his father, Ray Perry, and a former neighbor in Haskell County, the late Watt R. Matthews (born 1899), who Perry said taught him "not only about Texas and [its] history... but also about the importance of the values that we learned growing up in a [[rural]] environment".{{cite news|url=http://lubbockonline.com/stories/102401/loc_1024010044.shtml|first=Dirk|last=Fillpot|title=Perry becomes a driving force|date=October 24, 2001|work=[[Lubbock Avalanche-Journal]]|accessdate=September 5, 2013}} Perry is a member of the National Society of the [[Sons of the American Revolution]] and was awarded its Gold Good Citizenship Medal.[http://www.txssar.org/perry.htm Gov. Rick Perry Inducted], txssar.org, February 11, 2010. ==Electoral history== {{Election box begin no change |title= [[Texas gubernatorial election, 2002]]}} {{Election box winning candidate with party }} '''Robert James Kenneth Peston''' (born 25 April 1960) is a British journalist, presenter, and founder of the education charity Speakers for Schools. He is the Political Editor of [[ITV News]] and host of the weekly political discussion show ''[[Peston (TV show)|Peston]]'' (previously ''[[Peston on Sunday]]''). From February 2006 until March 2014, he was the Business Editor for [[BBC News]] and Economics Editor from March 2014 to November 2015. He became known to a wider public with his reporting of the [[late-2000s financial crisis]], especially with his [[scoop (news)|scoop]] on [[Nationalisation of Northern Rock|the Northern Rock crisis]]. ==Early life and education== Peston is from a Jewish family and is the son of the late [[Maurice Peston, Baron Peston|Lord Peston]], an economist and Labour [[life peer]], and Helen Conroy. As the son of a life baron, he is entitled to the courtesy title "The Honourable", but does not use it. Peston attended [[Highgate Wood Secondary School]], in [[Crouch End]], [[North London]],{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/features/3635393/Robert-Peston-Im-not-going-to-become-smooth-and-phoney.html |title=Robert Peston: 'I'm not going to become smooth and phoney'|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=24 January 2008 |accessdate=8 October 2008 | location=London | first=Elizabeth | last=Grice}} graduated from [[Balliol College, Oxford|Balliol College]], [[University of Oxford|Oxford]], and then studied at the [[Université Libre de Bruxelles]]. ==Career== [[File:Robert Peston and crew, 2016 Labour Party Conference.jpg|thumb|Peston with a film crew at the 2016 Labour Party Conference]] Peston briefly worked as a stockbroker at Williams de Broë,{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/2928108/Peston-in-line-as-BBC-voice-of-business.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |title=Peston in line as BBC voice of business |first=Dominic |last=White |date=10 December 2005 |accessdate=28 February 2009}} becoming a journalist in 1983 at the ''[[Investors Chronicle]]'' and joining ''[[The Independent]]'' newspaper on its launch in 1986. From 1989 to 1990, Peston worked for the short-lived ''[[Sunday Correspondent]]'' newspaper as Deputy City Editor, before being appointed City Editor of the ''[[Independent on Sunday]]'' in 1990.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2005/dec/19/mondaymediasection7 |title=This man means business at the BBC |author=Silver, James |date=19 December 2005 |accessdate=28 February 2009 |newspaper=The Guardian | location=London}} From 1991 to 2000, he worked for the ''[[Financial Times]]''. At the ''FT'', he was – at various times – Political Editor, Banking Editor and head of an investigations unit (which he founded). During his time as Political Editor, he memorably fell out with the then Downing Street Press Secretary [[Alastair Campbell]], who regularly mimicked Peston's habit of flicking back his hair, and once responded to a difficult question with the words: "Another question from the Peston school of smartarse journalism."{{cite web |url=http://www.thefirstpost.co.uk/people,1482,robert-peston-thorn-in-darlings-side,48854 |title=Robert Peston, thorn in Darling's side|date=8 October 2008 |accessdate=28 February 2009 |work=The First Post}} He became close friends with fellow journalist, now PR man, [[Roland Rudd]], where the two were known as the "Pest and the Rat".{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/32df3c52-c2f1-11e0-8cc7-00144feabdc0.html|title=The networker|publisher=''Financial Times''|first=Lucy |last=Kellaway|date=12 August 2011|accessdate=18 May 2015}} His last position at the ''FT'' was Financial Editor (in charge of business and financial coverage). In 2000, he became editorial director of the online financial analysis service Quest, owned by the financial firm Collins Stewart. At the same time, he became a contributing editor of ''[[The Spectator]]'' and a weekly columnist for ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''. In 2001, he switched allegiance from the ''Telegraph'' to the ''[[Sunday Times]]'', where he wrote a weekly business profile, Peston's People, and left ''The Spectator'' for the ''[[New Statesman]],'' where he wrote a weekly column.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/newswatch/ifs/hi/newsid_4950000/newsid_4950500/4950578.stm |title=Robert Peston |publisher=BBC| date=14 July 2006 |accessdate=28 February 2009}} In 2002, he joined ''[[The Sunday Telegraph]]'' as City editor and assistant editor. He became associate editor in 2005. In late 2005, it was announced that Peston would succeed [[Jeff Randall (reporter)|Jeff Randall]] as BBC Business Editor, responsible for business and City coverage on the corporation's flagship TV and radio news programmes, the [[BBC News Channel]], its [[BBC Online|website]] and on [[BBC Radio 4|Radio 4]]'s ''[[Today Programme|Today]]''.{{cite news |title=He may sound like a Dalek doing a bad impression of Kenneth Williams, but why DO so many BBC stars want to exterminate Pesto? |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/debate/article-2063409/He-sound-like-Dalek-doing-bad-impression-Kenneth-Williams-DO-BBC-stars-want-exterminate-Pesto.html |newspaper=[[Daily Mail]] |location=London|first=Andrew| last=Pierce |date=18 November 2011}} While no impropriety on the part of Peston was implied, it was claimed in ''The Observer''{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2008/oct/19/bbc-peston-creditcrunch |title=SFO probe |author=Helm, Toby|work=The Guardian|location=London|accessdate=16 September 2014}} on 19 October 2008, that the [[Serious Fraud Office (United Kingdom)|Serious Fraud Office]] (SFO) could enquire into the source of one of Peston's scoops which, in September 2008, in the fraught atmosphere of the [[global financial crisis]], revealed that merger talks between [[HBOS]] and [[Lloyds TSB]] were at an advanced stage. In the minutes before the broadcast, buyers purchased millions of HBOS shares at the deflated price of 96p; in the hour following it, they could be sold for 215p. The [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] MP [[Greg Hands]] had written to the SFO about this. On 4 February 2009, Peston appeared as a witness at the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|House of Commons]] [[Treasury Select Committee]], along with [[Alex Brummer]] (City Editor, ''[[Daily Mail]]''), [[Lionel Barber]] (editor of the ''[[Financial Times]]''), [[Simon Jenkins|Sir Simon Jenkins]] (''The Guardian'') and [[Sky News]] Business Editor [[Jeff Randall (journalist)|Jeff Randall]] to answer questions on the role of the media in financial stability and "whether financial journalists should operate under any form of reporting restrictions during banking crises."Treasury Committee [http://webarchive.parliament.uk/20090619012820/http://www.parliament.uk/parliamentary_committees/treasury_committee/tc0809pn12.cfm Treasury Committee: Press List] On 28 August 2009, Peston had a highly publicised row with [[James Murdoch (media executive)|James Murdoch]], following the latter's MacTaggart lecture.{{cite web|url=http://www.c21media.net/archives/45052|title=Murdoch, Peston in Edinburgh bust-up|publisher=''C21 Media''|first=Adam|last=Benzine|date=29 August 2009}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2009/aug/30/robert-peston-james-murdoch-bbc|title=BBC's Robert Peston in furious face-to-face row with James Murdoch|work=The Observer|first1=Leigh|last1=Holmwood|first2=James|last2=Robinson|location=London|date=30 August 2009}} More recently, he has repeatedly broken stories relating to [[News International]]'s [[News International phone hacking scandal|involvement with phone hacking]] at times which were perceived as advantageous to the company, leading to criticisms that he has become a Murdoch stooge.{{cite web|url=http://ianbone.wordpress.com/2011/07/12/bbcs-robert-peston-is-conduit-for-murdoch-leaks-undermining-cop-inquiry-into-corruption/|title=BBC's Robert Peston Is Conduit For Murdoch Leaks Undermining Cop Inquiry Into Corruption|work=Ian Bone|accessdate=16 September 2014}}{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/press/bbc-in-a-spin-over-robert-pestons-inside-track-to-news-international-2312701.html | title=BBC in a spin over Robert Peston's inside track to News International | location=London | work=The Independent | first=Ian | last=Burrell | date=13 July 2011}} Peston is the founder of Speakers for Schools, a pro-bono education venture which organises speakers from the worlds of business, politics, media, the arts, science, engineering and sports to give talks for free in state schools.{{cite web|url=http://www.speakers4schools.org/about-us/|title=About Us – Speakers for Schools|publisher=speakers4schools.org|accessdate=16 September 2014}} On 17 October 2013, Peston was appointed Economics Editor of [[BBC News]], replacing [[Stephanie Flanders]] who was appointed as Chief Market Strategist at [[JP Morgan Asset Management]]. He continued as Business Editor, as well until his replacement [[Kamal Ahmed (journalist)|Kamal Ahmed]] took over the post on 24 March 2014.{{cite news |title=Robert Peston to become BBC economics editor |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-24574963 |publisher=BBC News |date=17 October 2013 |accessdate=24 October 2013}} On 4 October 2015, it was announced that Peston would leave the BBC to join [[ITV News]] as their Political Editor, replacing [[Tom Bradby]] who became the main presenter of ''[[ITV News at Ten|News at Ten]]''. Peston made his last appearance on [[BBC News]] on 25 November 2015, and his first appearance on ITV's ''News at Ten'' on 11 January 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.itv.com/presscentre/press-releases/robert-peston-joins-itv-news-expert-line-political-editor|title=Robert Peston joins ITV News' expert line-up as Political Editor|publisher=ITV.com|date=7 October 2015|accessdate=6 July 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2016-01-09/hello-and-welcome-to-my-new-home-as-itv-political-editor|title=Hello and welcome to my new home as ITV political editor|date=9 January 2016|accessdate=6 July 2016}} He had a significant scoop in April 2016, when Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] stated in an interview he had profited from his father's offshore [[Blairmore Holdings]] trust, after information about the trust had been disclosed in the [[Panama Papers]] release. He presents [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]]'s new weekly political discussion show, ''[[Peston on Sunday]]'', which started on 8 May 2016.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/robert-peston-on-finding-love-after-the-death-of-his-wife-being/ |title=Robert Peston on finding love after the death of his wife, being a single father and the BBC versus ITV |first=Jessamy|last=Calkin |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=8 May 2016 |accessdate=10 May 2016}} In 2018, the programme moved to a Wednesday night timeslot, rebranded to ''[[Peston (TV show)|Peston]]''.{{cite web |last1=Waterson |first1=Jim |title=Robert Peston moves to midweek ITV slot after poor viewing figures |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/jun/06/robert-peston-moves-to-midweek-itv-slot-after-poor-viewing-figures |website=The Guardian |accessdate=26 October 2018}} ==Awards== [[File:Robert Peston does radio (cropped).jpg|upright|thumb|Peston reporting for the BBC, 2009]] Peston has won the Harold Wincott Senior Financial Journalist of the Year Award (2005), the [[London Press Club]]'s Scoop of the Year Award (2005), [[Granada Television]]'s ''[[What the Papers Say]]'' award for Investigative Journalist of the Year (1994) and the Wincott Young Financial Journalist of the Year (1986). At the [[Royal Television Society]]'s Television Journalism Awards 2008/09 Peston won both "Specialist Journalist of the Year" and "Television Journalist of the Year" for his coverage of the credit crunch and a string of 'scoops' associated with it.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7914421.stm|title=BBC's Robert Peston scoops awards|publisher=BBC|date=27 January 2009|accessdate=6 July 2016}} Also, his scoop on Lloyds TSB's takeover of HBOS won the Royal Television Society's "Scoop of the Year" award. He was voted Best Performer in a Non-Acting Role in the Broadcasting Press Guild's 2009 awards{{cite web|url=http://www.broadcastingpressguild.org/?page_id=536|title=2009 Awards|publisher=Broadcasting Press Guild|accessdate=16 September 2014}} and Business Journalist of the Year in the London Press Club's 2009 awards. In the 2008 Wincott Awards, he won the Broadcaster of the Year Award and he won the online award for his blog. In 2009, he was named Political Journalist of the Year in the Political Studies Association Awards, and he topped polls of the general public and journalists carried out by ''[[Press Gazette]]'' to find the highest rated finance and business journalist. Peston's scoop on [[Northern Rock]] seeking emergency financial help from the Bank of England won the [[Royal Television Society]]'s Television Journalism Award for Scoop of the Year in the 2007/8 awards and the Wincott Award for Business News/Current Affairs Programme of the Year. He was Journalist of the Year in the Business Journalism of the Year Awards for 2007/08, and also won in the Scoop category. Peston won the [[The Work Foundation|Work Foundation]]'s Broadcast News Journalism Award and the Foundation's Radio Programme of the Year Award (for his ''[[File on 4]]'', "The Inside Story of Northern Rock").{{cite web |url=http://www.theworkfoundation.com/pressmedia/news/newsarticle.aspx?oItemId=53 |date=28 January 2008 |accessdate=21 April 2009 |title=Winners of the Workworld media awards announced |publisher=The Work Foundation |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110717044738/http://www.theworkfoundation.com/pressmedia/news/newsarticle.aspx?oItemId=53 |archivedate=17 July 2011 }} His blog won the digital media category in the Private Equity and Venture Capital Journalist of the Year Awards.{{cite web|url=http://bvca.positive-internet.com/doc.php?id=793 |title=BVCA Private Equity and Venture Capital Journalist of the Year Award Winners |publisher=BVCA |accessdate=21 April 2009 }}{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Peston received an Honorary Doctorate from [[Heriot-Watt University]] in 2010.{{Cite web|url=https://www.hw.ac.uk/news/archive/2010/design-science-engineering-and-sport-among-heriot-watt-honorary-degrees.htm|title=Design, science, engineering and sport among Heriot-Watt honorary degrees|publisher=Heriot-Watt University|date=8 July 2010|accessdate=6 July 2016}} In 2011, he was honoured as a Fellow of [[Aberystwyth University]] in recognition of "his success in journalism, his insightful writing and his contribution to the local community".{{cite web |url=http://www.aber.ac.uk/en/news/archive/2011/07/title-101020-en.html |title=Robert Peston honoured as Fellow |publisher=Aberystwyth University|accessdate=3 September 2013}} ==Delivery style== Peston's delivery on radio and television news has attracted comment. Richard Wenner complained of it being that of a "verbal slug – leaving a trail of audio slime". Tim Teeman in ''[[The Times]]'' described his "intonation" as "raggedy [and] querulous" in 2008,{{cite news|last1=Teeman|first1=Tim|title=Bianca barrels back on to EastEnders|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/bianca-barrels-back-on-to-eastenders-tbp5fj878rc|accessdate=13 June 2017|work=The Times|subscription=y|date=2 April 2008|quote=Agggh. What is it with Robert Peston’s raggedy, querulous intonation?}} and [[Ann Treneman]] described Peston as "excruciatingly hard to listen to" in 2009.{{cite news|last1=Treneman|first1=Ann|authorlink1=Ann Treneman|title=Appalling delivery, rambling replies but the Robert Peston show is a masterclass|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/appalling-delivery-rambling-replies-but-the-robert-peston-show-is-a-masterclass-v9pq9w7ph9g|accessdate=13 June 2017|work=The Times|subscription=y|date=5 February 2009|quote=But this was the Peston show because Pesto, as he is called, has had a very, very good credit crunch. His stories have made him a star almost, it must be said, despite himself. For this is a man who can be excruciatingly hard to listen to. Many is the morning when I shout at the radio: 'Spit it out, man!'}} ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' identifies "strangulated diction" and "repetition of small words" among his traits; in the same article, maintaining he is "loads better than [he] was", Peston himself conceded he is "still not as polished as some".{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/portal/main.jhtml?xml=/portal/2008/01/24/ftpeston124.xml|title=Robert Peston Interview|date=24 January 2008|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|accessdate=16 September 2014}} His characteristic mannerisms have been observed by impressionist [[Rory Bremner]].{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/3562776/Bremner,-Bird-and-Fortune-Silly-Money.html|title=Bremner, Bird and Fortune: Silly Money|date=1 November 2008|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|accessdate=16 September 2014}} Peston has stated "I am not going to endeavour to become somebody hugely smooth and polished."{{cite web |url=http://thelondonpaper.typepad.com/thelondonblog/2009/03/cheryl-loses-tv-crown-to-er-bbc-new-man.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090330173739/http://thelondonpaper.typepad.com/thelondonblog/2009/03/cheryl-loses-tv-crown-to-er-bbc-new-man.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=30 March 2009 |title=Cheryl loses TV crown to, er, BBC news man |publisher=''thelondonpaper'' |date=27 March 2009 }} ==Books== Peston published his biography of [[Gordon Brown]], ''Brown's Britain'', in January 2005. It details the rivalry between Brown and the then Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]]. ''Brown's Britain'' was described by [[Howard Davies (economist)|Sir Howard Davies]], former director of the [[London School of Economics]], as "a book of unusual political significance". The cover of the book describes how "Peston was given unprecedented access to Gordon Brown and his friends and colleagues." Having told Brown's side of the Blair/Brown power struggle, it is believed that Peston used the relationship then built up with Brown for many of his later financial news story "scoops" at the BBC.{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} In February 2008, [[Hodder & Stoughton]] published Peston's book ''Who Runs Britain? How the Super-Rich are Changing our Lives.'' In ''[[The Guardian]]'', [[Polly Toynbee]] said of it: "Reading Peston's book, you can only be flabbergasted all over again at how Labour kowtowed to wealth, glorified the City and put all the nation's economic eggs into one dangerous basket of fizzy finance."{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2008/feb/19/labour.economy?gusrc=rss&feed=politics |work=The Guardian |date=19 February 2008 |accessdate=28 February 2009 |title=Labour's election hopes rely on things they don't control |first=Polly|last=Toynbee}} In September 2012, Hodder & Stoughton published ''How Do We Fix This Mess? The Economic Price of Having it All and the Route to Lasting Prosperity''. ''The Observer'' described it as "A must read...mandatory reading for anyone who wants to have a voice in where we go from here." His latest book ''WTF'' was published by Hodder & Stoughton in November 2017 and charts the events that led up to the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|2016 Brexit referendum]]. [[Vernon Bogdanor]] in the ''Financial Times'' said it was "a deeply thoughtful analysis that should be mandatory reading for anyone seeking to understand where we have gone wrong."{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} == Filmography == === Television === {| class="wikitable" !Year !Title !Role !Notes |- |2014 |''How China Fooled the World'' |Presenter |{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34261550|title=How China fooled the world with Robert Peston – BBC News|website=BBC News|language=en-GB|access-date=20 August 2016}} |- |2012 |''The Great Euro Crash'' |Presenter |{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01hy4xr|title=The Great Euro Crash with Robert Peston – BBC Two|website=BBC|access-date=20 August 2016}} |- |2013 |''Robert Peston Goes Shopping'' |Presenter |{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b039q44y |title=Robert Peston Goes Shopping – BBC Two |website=BBC|accessdate=27 January 2017}} |- |2015 |''Quelle Catastrophe! France'' |Presenter |{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b055kqhw|title=Quelle Catastrophe! France with Robert Peston, This World – BBC Two|website=BBC|access-date=20 August 2016}} |- |2016 |''The Great Chinese Crash?'' |Presenter |{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p03g89n5|title=The Great Chinese Crash? With Robert Peston, This World – BBC Two|website=BBC|access-date=20 August 2016}} |- |2016— |''[[Peston on Sunday]]'' |Presenter | |- |2016 |''[[The Agenda with Tom Bradby|The Agenda]]'' |Guest presenter | |- |} ==Personal life== [[File:Robert Peston, June 2007.jpg|thumb|right|Peston, June 2007]] Peston married the writer [[Siân Busby]] in 1998, with whom he had a son, Maximilian.[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/9526100/Sian-Busby.html Obituary: Siân Busby], telegraph.co.uk, 6 September 2012 Peston and Busby had known each other since their teens, and only rekindled their relationship after her friend, Peston's sister Juliet, was hospitalised after a road accident.Elizabeth Grice [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/features/3635393/Robert-Peston-Im-not-going-to-become-smooth-and-phoney.html "Robert Peston: 'I'm not going to become smooth and phoney'"], ''The Daily Telegraph'', 24 January 2008 In the meantime, Busby had married and been divorced from the Dutch film maker Kees Ryninks, with whom she also had a son, Simon. Busby died in September 2012 from lung cancer, after a long illness.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-19490209 |title=Robert Peston – Leave of absence |work=BBC |date=5 September 2012 |accessdate=5 January 2014}} He lives in [[Muswell Hill]], north London. After a domestic burglary in December 2012, Peston made an appeal for the return of rings that had belonged to his late wife. Peston said: "It's an incredibly distressing time, especially so soon after losing Siân. It's not about the monetary value, it's about the sentimental value. The rings are irreplaceable and they mean a lot to me."{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/crime/9758431/BBC-business-editor-Robert-Peston-appeals-for-return-of-late-wifes-stolen-rings.html|title=BBC business editor Robert Peston appeals for return of late wife's stolen rings|work=The Daily Telegraph|first=Sam|last=Marsden|location=London|date=20 December 2012|accessdate=12 August 2013}} In September 2018, as part of an interview with '' [[The Sunday Times Magazine]]'', Peston described feeling "desperately guilty" after falling in love with another woman several years after his wife's death. Peston said that he was now in a relationship with Charlotte Edwardes, the diary editor of London's ''[[London Evening Standard|Evening Standard]]''. They met at a Christmas party, and had previously worked together briefly.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-45617514|title=Peston: I felt guilt after falling in love again|date=23 September 2018|work=BBC News|access-date=23 September 2018|language=en-GB}} His family is of Jewish descent. Peston has described himself as "culturally [[Jewish]]".{{cite news|url=http://www.thejc.com/business/business-features/robert-peston-the-bbc-reporter-who-means-business|title=Robert Peston: The BBC reporter who means business|work=The Jewish Chronicle|date=21 February 2008|accessdate=16 September 2014}} He supports [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/thereporters/robertpeston/2007/01/about_robert_peston.html |title=Peston's Picks: About Robert Peston |work=BBC |accessdate=5 January 2014}} ==Style and titles== *Robert James Kenneth Peston (1960–87) *The Honourable Robert James Kenneth Peston (1987–) ==See also== *[[Courtesy titles in the United Kingdom]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *{{itv.com|id=robertpeston|title=Robert Peston}} *{{Facebook|pestonitv|Robert Peston}} *{{Twitter}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130509070609/http://www.debretts.com/people/biographies/browse/p/26244/Robert%20James%20Kenneth+PESTON.aspx ''Debrett's People of Today''] * [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/correspondents/robertpeston/ Peston's blog] on BBC site {{s-start}} {{s-media}} {{s-bef|before=[[Jeff Randall (journalist)|Jeff Randall]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Business Editor of [[BBC News]]|years=2006–2014}} {{s-aft|after=[[Kamal Ahmed (journalist)|Kamal Ahmed]]|rows=2}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Stephanie Flanders]]
([[Hugh Pym]] acting)}} {{s-ttl|title=Economics Editor of [[BBC News]]|years=2013–2016}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Tom Bradby]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Political Editor of [[ITV News]]|years=2016–present}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Peston, Robert}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of Balliol College, Oxford]] [[Category:Ashkenazi Jews]] [[Category:BBC newsreaders and journalists]] [[Category:English non-fiction writers]] [[Category:British biographers]] [[Category:British business and financial journalists]] [[Category:British business writers]] [[Category:British non-fiction writers]] [[Category:English biographers]] [[Category:English bloggers]] [[Category:English Jews]] [[Category:English male journalists]] [[Category:English male non-fiction writers]] [[Category:Free University of Brussels alumni]] [[Category:ITN newsreaders and journalists]] [[Category:Online journalists]] [[Category:People educated at Highgate Wood Secondary School]] [[Category:People from London]] [[Category:People with speech impediment]] [[Category:Peston family|Robert Peston]] [[Category:Financial Times people]] [[Category:The Independent people]] [[Category:People from Muswell Hill]] [[Category:The Sunday Times people]]

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Ryan Dunn | image =File:Ryan Dunn Jackass 3D London Premiere 2.jpg | alt = | caption = Dunn at the ''[[Jackass 3D]]'' London Premiere on October 2, 2010. | birth_name = Ryan Matthew Dunn | birth_date = {{birth date|mf=yes|1977|6|11}} | birth_place = [[Medina, Ohio]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|mf=yes|2011|6|20|1977|6|11}} | death_place = [[West Goshen Township, Chester County, Pennsylvania]], U.S. | death_cause = Car crash | resting_place = Highland Drive Cemetery, Brecksville, Ohio, U.S. | nationality = American | home_town = [[Brecksville, Ohio]], U.S. | other_names = Random Hero
Prima Dunna
Plugs
Cryin' Ryan (Child) | known_for = Star of ''[[Jackass (TV series)|Jackass]]'' | occupation = Stunt performer, television personality, comedian, actor, writer, musician | yearsactive = 1997–2011 | website = | partner = Angie Cuturic (2002–2011; his death) }} '''Ryan Matthew Dunn''' (June 11, 1977 – June 20, 2011){{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/06/21/arts/television/ryan-dunn-daredevil-comedian-of-jackass-dies-at-34.html |title=Ryan Dunn, Daredevil Comedian, Dies at 34 |author=Daniel E. Slotnik |date=June 20, 2011 |work=[[The New York Times]]}} was an American stunt performer, television personality, comedian, actor, writer, musician, and one of the stars of the [[MTV]] reality stunt show ''[[Jackass (TV series)|Jackass]]''. Dunn rose to fame in the late 1990s as a member of the [[List of CKY Crew members|CKY Crew]] with his long-time friend, [[Bam Margera]], for their extreme stunts and pranks recorded on camera, which led to the rise of ''Jackass''. Dunn also hosted ''[[Homewrecker (TV series)|Homewrecker]]'' and ''[[Proving Ground (TV series)|Proving Ground]]'', and appeared in the feature films ''[[Blonde Ambition]]'' and ''[[Street Dreams (film)|Street Dreams]]'', as well as in Margera's films ''[[Haggard: The Movie|Haggard]]'' and ''[[Minghags: The Movie|Minghags]]''. Dunn died in a car crash in 2011. == Career == Dunn took part in the characteristic stunts that made ''Jackass'' famous, and featured in three released films, ''[[Jackass: The Movie]]'', ''[[Jackass Number Two]]'' and ''[[Jackass 3D]]''. In [[Gumball 3000#2006|2006]], Dunn and Bam Margera participated in the [[Gumball 3000]] road rally in Margera's [[Lamborghini Gallardo]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gtspirit.com/2006/04/12/bam-margera-and-dunn-in-gumball-2006 |title=Bam Margera and Dunn in Gumball 2006 |publisher=GTspirit.com |date=April 12, 2006 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} He later went on a tour with [[Vincent Margera|Don Vito]] called "The Dunn and Vito Rock Tour" for which the DVD was released on March 20, 2007.{{cite web |last=Margera |first=Bam |url=https://www.amazon.com/Dunn-Vitos-Rock-Tour/dp/B000LPS2PY |title=Dunn & Vito's Rock Tour: Movies & TV: Ryan Dunn, Steve-O, Don Vito |publisher=Amazon.com |accessdate=June 20, 2011}} Dunn and Margera again participated in the rally in [[Gumball 3000#2008|2008]]. Bam Margera stated during a December 2, 2008, radio interview with ''Big O and Dukes'' of 106.7 [[WJFK-FM]], that he and Dunn would be going to Italy to film ''Where the F*%# Are My Ancestors''.[http://www.wjfk.com/topic/play_window.php?audioType=Episode&audioId=3156296 Interview with Big O and Dukes WJFK 1067] {{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} That same month, Dunn appeared on the episode "[[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit episodes#Season 10|Smut]]" of ''[[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]]'' in December 2008. He is also featured in a movie called ''[[Street Dreams (film)|Street Dreams]]'' which was released in spring 2009. He co-starred along with [[Rob Dyrdek]] and [[Paul Rodriguez Jr]]. Dunn was also featured on a show with fellow ''Jackass'' star Bam Margera about them traveling through Europe in a ''Viva la Bam''-like show called ''[[Bam's World Domination]]'' for [[Spike (TV channel)|Spike]]. He appeared in ''Jackass 3D'', which was released on October 15, 2010. Dunn co-hosted [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4]]'s ''Proving Ground'' along with [[Jessica Chobot]], which made its premiere on June 14, 2011, six days before his death.{{cite web |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2011/05/05/g4s-proving-ground-takes-viewers-on-a-roller-coaster-ride-of-trial-and-error-when-new-series-premieres-june-14th-at-8-pm-et-pt-992000/20110505g401 |title="G4's Proving Ground" Takes Viewers on a Roller Coaster Ride of Trial and Error When New Series Premieres June 14th at 8 PM ET/PT |accessdate=July 13, 2011 |date=May 5, 2011}} However, according to a G4 spokesperson, the channel decided to postpone the airing of further episodes. The spokesperson added, "The show is off the schedule as of today until we discuss next steps."{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/the-tv-column-g4-pulls-this-weeks-proving-ground-after-ryan-dunns-death/2011/06/20/AGZyWVdH_story.html |title=The TV Column: G4 pulls this week's 'Proving Ground' after Ryan Dunn's death |publisher=Washingstonpost.com |date=June 10, 2011 |accessdate=June 10, 2011 |first=Ellen |last=McCarthy}} On June 27, G4 announced they would air the remaining episodes starting on July 19, 2011.{{cite news |url=http://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/06/27/g4-will-show-remaining-episodes-of-series-featuring-ryan-dunn |title=G4 Will Show Remaining Episodes of Series Featuring Ryan Dunn |work=The New York Times |date=June 27, 2011 |accessdate=June 27, 2011 |first=Dave |last=Itzkoff}}{{cite news |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1666483/ryan-dunn-proving-ground-g4.jhtml |title=Ryan Dunn's 'Proving Ground' Returns To G4 in July |publisher=MTV |date=June 27, 2011 |accessdate=June 27, 2011}} At the time of his death, Dunn was working on the film ''Welcome to the Bates Motel''. The film was later renamed ''The Bates Haunting'' and was released in 2013. == Personal life == Dunn was born in [[Medina, Ohio]] and spent much of his childhood in [[Brecksville, Ohio]]. From 2002 to his death, Dunn was in a long-term relationship with Angie Cuturic, who had a part in Margera's directorial debut ''Haggard: The Movie'' and later ''[[Minghags]]''. Dunn had several tattoos of Cuturic, including in his inner arm and left ring finger.{{cite news |url=http://globalgrind.com/entertainment/ryan-dunns-girlfriend-angie-cuturic-woman-behind-tragedy-photos |publisher=Global Grind |title=Ryan Dunn's Girlfriend, Angie Cuturic: The Woman Behind The Tragedy (PHOTOS) |author=Global Grind |date=June 24, 2011 |location=London |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120117071706/http://globalgrind.com/entertainment/ryan-dunns-girlfriend-angie-cuturic-woman-behind-tragedy-photos |archivedate=January 17, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} During shooting of the closing scenes for ''Jackass Number Two'' in 2006, Dunn injured his shoulder during one of his final bits, where he and co-star [[Bam Margera]] are pulled out of shot by a running horse by a rope tied around their feet. Dunn dropped straight onto his shoulder, causing damage to the muscles and leading to a [[blood clot]] that was at one point life-threatening, due to its proximity to his heart and brain. While seeking treatment for it and [[Lyme disease]], Dunn became depressed, eventually cutting off all contact with his friends, co-workers, and others for nearly two years, and did not participate in ''[[Jackassworld.com: 24 Hour Takeover]]'', or any subsequent events related to the films and series.A Tribute to Ryan Dunn: MTV special He eventually returned to the Jackass cast in the production of ''Jackass 3D'' and ''[[Jackass 3.5]]'' later saying that he was happy to rejoin the cast and had more enjoyment working on ''Jackass 3D'' than any previous film endeavors. == Death == [[File:Ryan Dunn crash scene.jpg|thumb|upright|[[Roadside memorial]]s left at the crash site]] On June 20, 2011, at around 3:30 a.m. [[North American Eastern Time Zone|EDT]], Dunn and Zachary Hartwell, a production assistant on ''Jackass Number Two'',{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/jun/22/ryan-dunn-car-crash-coroner |work=The Guardian |title=Ryan Dunn died from impact and heat of crash, says coroner |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=June 22, 2011 |location=London}} were killed when Dunn's [[Porsche 911 GT3]] veered off the road, struck a tree, and burst into flames in West Goshen Township, Chester County, Pennsylvania.{{cite web |url=http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=news/entertainment&id=8200859 |title='Jackass' star Ryan Dunn killed in Pa. crash |date=June 20, 2011 |publisher=[[WPVI-TV]], [[ABC Owned Television Stations]] |accessdate=June 30, 2011 |location=Philadelphia, Pennsylvania}}{{cite news |work=The Huffington Post |title=Ryan Dunn Dead: 'Jackass' Star Dies In Car Crash |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/06/20/ryan-dunn-dead-jackass-star-car-crash_n_880322.html |accessdate=June 20, 2011 |date=June 20, 2011}} Dunn had turned 34 nine days prior. He was buried at Highland Drive Cemetery, Brecksville, Ohio. Hours before the crash, Dunn had posted a photo to his Twitter account of himself and Hartwell drinking at a West Chester bar.{{cite web|work=The Calgary Herald |title=Jackass star Ryan Dunn died of blunt, thermal trauma caused by fiery car wreck: coroner |url=http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/Jackass+star+Ryan+Dunn+died+blunt+thermal+trauma+caused+fiery+wreck+coroner/4983508/story.html |accessdate=June 27, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110625021933/http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/Jackass+star+Ryan+Dunn+died+blunt+thermal+trauma+caused+fiery+wreck+coroner/4983508/story.html |archivedate=June 25, 2011 }} Dunn was identified in the police report as the vehicle's driver,{{cite news |title=West Goshen Township Police Department, Press Release |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/sites/default/files/westgoshenpdpressrelease.pdf |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} and a subsequent [[toxicology]] report showed Dunn had a blood alcohol level of 0.196 g/dL – more than twice the state's maximum legal limit of 0.08%.{{cite web |title=Ryan Dunn Was Drunk and Speeding: Police |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/ryan-dunn-jackass-blood-alcohol-level-limit/story?id=13902127 |date=June 22, 2011 |accessdate=June 22, 2011}} The police report stated "speed may have been a contributing factor in the crash" and preliminary investigations suggested the car had been traveling between {{convert|132|and|140|mph}} in a {{convert|55|mph}} zone.{{cite news |title=Police: 'Jackass' star Ryan Dunn was drunk and driving over 132 mph |url=http://www.cnn.com/2011/SHOWBIZ/celebrity.news.gossip/06/22/ryan.dunn.drunk/ |accessdate=June 23, 2011 |publisher=CNN |date=June 22, 2011}} In August 2012, the parents of Zachary Hartwell filed a [[civil suit]] in the [[Pennsylvania Courts of Common Pleas|Court of Common Pleas]] of [[Philadelphia County]], naming the co-administrators of Dunn's estate as defendants, along with Barnaby's West Chester, the Pennsylvania bar where Dunn drank prior to the fatal crash. The suit claims negligence and recklessness, as well as wrongful death in the incident that killed 30-year-old Hartwell. The plaintiffs claim that Dunn displayed negligence and recklessness in failing to have his vehicle under adequate and proper control, operating his vehicle under the influence of alcohol, operating his vehicle at an excessive speed and violently veering off a road and into a tree, among other alleged transgressions. They are seeking unspecified punitive and compensatory damages, as well as interest, court costs and "delay damages as the law may allow."{{cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/08/10/ryan-dunn-lawsuit-estate-sued-parents-dead-passenger_n_1765600.html|title=Ryan Dunn Lawsuit: ‘Jackass’ Star’s Estate Sued By Parents Of Dead Passenger (VIDEO)|first=Huffington|last=Post|publisher=}} == Legacy == Dunn is remembered by friends and fans alike as the "go-to guy for outrageous stunts that even such stalwarts as Steve-O weren't willing to try" and "the kind of guy who would do anything for a friend," gaining the nickname "Random Hero".{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1676452/ryan-dunn-dead-2011-news.jhtml |title=Ryan Dunn's Death Shocked Us All in 2011 |author=Gil Kaufman |date=December 26, 2011 |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=December 26, 2011}} Following the news of his death, [[Dickhouse Productions]] and the producers of the show released the following statement:
I don't really know what to say right now everybody, because the sadness is overwhelming, but today we lost one of our own. Our brother Ryan Dunn has passed. He died in a car wreck in West Goshen, Pennsylvania this morning at 3 a.m. that's tough to write. Our hearts go out to his family and his beloved Angie. Ryan will be missed and remembered by us all. Thanks for the kind words of support everybody.
Many celebrities expressed their grief and condolences on Twitter including [[Sofia Coppola]], [[Tom Green]], [[Carey Hart]], [[Dwayne Johnson]], [[Tony Hawk]] and his ''Jackass'' cast members.{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1666070/ryan-dunn-dead-dies-car-crash.jhtml |title=Ryan Dunn Remembered By 'Jackass' Co-Stars, Fans |author=James Montgomery |date=June 20, 2011 |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=July 3, 2011}} [[Kings of Leon]] also paid homage to Dunn at their London Hyde Park concert by dedicating their song "McFearless" to him. [[Skrillex]] dedicated his remix of the song "Cinema" to Dunn after a moment of silence.{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/viral-videos/469980/kings-of-leon-salute-ryan-dunn-at-london-show |title=Kings of Leon Salute Ryan Dunn at London Show |author=Sophie Schillaci |date=June 23, 2011 |work=Billboard |accessdate=July 3, 2011}} [[Alkaline Trio]] also dedicated their song "Goodbye Forever" to Dunn on their fifteen-year anniversary tour. Singer/songwriter [[Roger Alan Wade]] wrote and composed the song dedicated to Dunn titled, "The Light Outlives the Star." Occasional ''Jackass'' member [[Loomis Fall]] also wrote the song "Bid Farewell" in memory of Dunn. Both songs were used in a music video tribute by Dickhouse Productions for its official website.{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1666761/ryan-dunn-tribute-video.jhtml |title=Ryan Dunn Remembered in Tribute Video |author=Kara Warner |date=July 1, 2011 |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=July 1, 2011}} Dunn also came in at number three in top trending searches of 2011 on Google's Zeitgeist report following his death.{{cite web |url=http://mashable.com/2011/12/15/most-searched-on-google/ |title=Google Zeitgeist: How the World Googled In 2011 |author=Lauren Indvick |date=December 15, 2011 |accessdate=December 15, 2011}} On November 28, 2011, MTV aired an hour-long tribute to Dunn, where several details of his life previously unknown to the public were revealed as well as never-before seen stunts he performed. Dunn's parents, sister, friends and both ''Jackass'' and ''Viva La Bam'' cast mates recalled his early beginnings to final months. {{Clear}} The 2013 film ''[[Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa]]'' is dedicated to Dunn. == Filmography == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film |- ! Year ! Title ! series)#CKY2K|CKY2K]]'' |Himself |Direct-to-video release |- |2001 |''[[CKY (video series)#CKY 3|CKY3]]'' |Himself |Direct-to-video release |- |2001 |''[[CKY (video series)#CKY Documentary|CKY revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.5)
revision.text:
{{orphan|date=June 2010}}
'''Saleem Karim''' born (born 1965 in [[Karachi]]) is a [[Pakistan]]i disabled [[Cricket]] Team founder, cricketer and a businessman. Karim, was born with [[polio]] in his right leg and later had accident while riding a bike, in which his left leg was effected.<ref>[http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/the-newspaper/sport/disable-team-to-feature-in-magna-cricket-series-669 Magna Cricket Series 669]. Dawn.com. Accessed May 9, 2012.</ref>
Despite all this, his interest to play cricket was not affected. He started playing cricket as a hobby but, as he grew older, he realized that there was a need to form a cricket team dedicated to the [[Disability|disabled people]], which would give them a chance to play with people with similar abilities.<ref>[http://www.vcricket.com/cricket-news/pakistan-s-disabled-cricket-team-embarks-on-first-tour-14973.html Pakistan's disabled cricket team embarks on first tour] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005121720/http://www.vcricket.com/cricket-news/pakistan-s-disabled-cricket-team-embarks-on-first-tour-14973.html |date=2011-10-05 }}. VCricket.com. Accessed May 9, 2012.</ref> Rather depending on the [[Pakistani government]] to support this cause, Karim went his way and founded a cricket team with people with disabilities in the year 2006. The team has since won many laurels and gained recognition in the country. Karim, funds the team himself. Karim, has also been able to organize two national championships, sparking country-wide interest.<ref>[http://www.malaysiacricket.com/NEWS/NEWS-ARCHIVES/CAPABLE-ASIA-FRONTIERS-SURVIVE-EARLY-PDCA-SCARE-AWAN-DEMOLISHED.asp Capable Asia Frontiers Survive Early PDCA Scare]. Malaysiacricket.com. Accessed May 9, 2012.</ref>
The Team has also done their first international tour of [[Malaysia]] and [[Singapore]].
== References == {{reflist}}
==External links== * *https://web.archive.org/web/20111005121720/http://www.vcricket.com/cricket-news/pakistan-s-disabled-cricket-team-embarks-on-first-tour-14973.html *http://www.sncricketleague.co.uk/ *http://www.malaysiacricket.com/html/s02_article/article_view.asp?art_id=1495&nav_cat_id=225&nav_top_id=86 *http://www.disablecricket.com/
{{DEFAULTSORT:Karim, Saleem}} [[Category:Cricket managers]] [[Category:People who compete in parasports]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1965 births]] [[Category:Pakistani people with disabilities]] [[Category:People with poliomyelitis]] [[Category:Pakistani cricket administrators]]

{{COI|date=September 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Scott Bolzan | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Scott Louis Bolzan | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1962|07|25}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | alma_mater = [[Northern Illinois University]] | known_for = | occupation = Former [[NFL]] and [[USFL]] player
[[Motivational speaker]] | spouse = {{marriage|Joan Bolzan|1984}} | website = http://www.scottbolzan.com }} '''Scott Louis Bolzan''' (born July 25, 1962) is a [[motivational speaker]], [[author]], [[entrepreneur]], former [[NFL]] and [[USFL]] [[American football|football player]], and the founder and [[CEO]] of Legendary Jets in [[Tempe, Arizona]]. In December 2008, he suffered a [[brain injury]] which has left him with profound [[retrograde amnesia]]. Scott, along with Joan Bolzan and [[Caitlin Rother]], have written a book titled ''My Life: Deleted'', which was published by [[Harper Collins]] and was released on October 4, 2011. ''My Life: Deleted'' appeared on [[The New York Times Best Seller List]] on October 8 at #16 for ebooks non-fiction and #29 for combined hardcover and ebooks non-fiction.{{cite news|url=http://www.allbusiness.com/reports-reviews-sections/profiles-biographies/12672598-1.html|title=Gilbert man struggles to remember his life|first=Scott|last=Bordow|publisher=[[East Valley Tribune]]|date=August 16, 2009|accessdate=October 5, 2010}} ==Early life== Scott Bolzan was born to Louis and Alice Bolzan in 1962. He grew up in Chicago, Illinois where he attended [[Northern Illinois University]] from 1980 to 1984 on a full [[athletic scholarship]]. It was there that he met his wife, Joan, whom he married in 1984. ==Football career== In college, Bolzan played [[American football|football]] for the [[Northern Illinois Huskies football|Northern Illinois Huskies]]. After graduating, he went on to play professionally, though his career lasted only two years. Bolzan was [[NFL draft|drafted]] in May 1984 by the [[New England Patriots]] in the 9th round.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=a6QyAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Oe8FAAAAIBAJ&pg=3804,917596&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=NFL Draft|publisher=[[Ottawa Citizen]]|date=May 2, 1984}} He was [[Waivers (American football)|waived]] by the Patriots in August of that year.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=h_EKAAAAIBAJ&sjid=708DAAAAIBAJ&pg=3544,4390557&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=Transactions|publisher=[[The Prescott Courier]]|date=August 22, 1984}} He went on to play for the [[Memphis Showboats]] in the [[USFL]] in 1985.{{cite web|url=http://www.nflalumniaz.org/about.html|title=About NFL Alumni Arizona|publisher=[[NFL Alumni]] Arizona|accessdate=October 5, 2010}} Bolzan was then picked up by the [[Cleveland Browns]] in May 1985{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=sPUPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Z48DAAAAIBAJ&pg=1977,4877971&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=Transactions|publisher=[[Ellensburg Daily Record]]|date=May 6, 1985}} and later waived in September 1985.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=ahYzAAAAIBAJ&sjid=RzIHAAAAIBAJ&pg=6916,107197&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=Familiar names are put on waivers as teams cut to 45|publisher=[[Lodi News-Sentinel]]|date=September 3, 1985}} He was re-signed later in the month{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=10ojAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Nc8FAAAAIBAJ&pg=4191,5356361&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=Transactions|publisher=[[The Palm Beach Post]]|date=September 27, 1985}} and cut in October.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=28sqAAAAIBAJ&sjid=0c4FAAAAIBAJ&pg=1106,1525886&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=Notes...|publisher=The Palm Beach Post|date=October 3, 1985}} Bolzan was signed by the Browns again in May 1986.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=lB0jAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Ac8FAAAAIBAJ&pg=4449,2464543&dq=scott+bolzan&hl=en|title=Transactions|publisher=The Palm Beach Post|date=May 3, 1986}} He was injured in August 1986 and retired soon after. ==Entrepreneurship== After his football career ended due to an injury, Bolzan entered the financial services field where he owned his own financial planning firm specializing in insurance and investments. After moving to [[Arizona]] in 1993, he took up [[aviation]], and later developed West Jet Aircraft—a charter company specializing in the charter of [[Lear Jet]]s and King Airs in the Scottsdale area of Arizona. West Jet grew to become the Number 1 Charter Operator in Arizona according to ''Arizona Ranking Magazine'' in 2007.{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} He sold West Jet aircraft in February 2008 and opened the doors of Legendary Jets shortly after, where he is the CEO/Founder specializing in private jet management. ==Brain injury== On December 17, 2008, Scott Bolzan slipped in the men's bathroom at his place of work.{{cite news|url=http://phoenix.bizjournals.com/phoenix/stories/2009/09/28/story3.html?b=1254110400%5E2156121|title=Entrepreneur suffers from amnesia following fall|first=Chris|last=Casacchia|publisher=[[Phoenix Business Journal]]|date=September 25, 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Nightline/amnesia-man-hits-head-loses-memories/story?id=10396719|title=Amnesia Man Hits Head Loses All Memories|publisher=[[ABC News]] ''[[Nightline]]''|date=April 19, 2010}} He says his last "actual memory" was "my feet going above my head". The fall caused a severe [[concussion]]. Bolzan was initially told his [[memory loss]] was normal and temporary, but as months passed by and he still did not remember any part of his life before the fall, he revealed his condition to his wife and they sought help from [[neurologist]]s. A [[SPECT scan]] of Bolzan's [[human brain|brain]] showed that he had no [[blood flow]] to his right [[temporal lobe]]—the part of the brain that stores [[long-term memory]]. Blood flow to the front of his brain on both sides is also dramatically reduced. He suffered brain [[atrophy]], which killed [[brain cells]] and damaged connections between them. The loss of blood flow caused Bolzan to suffer an unusually severe case of [[retrograde amnesia]]. Dr. Teresa Lanier, Bolzan's primary physician, has said "It would basically have to be a miracle for him to one day wake up and have complete and intact memory of everything he has lost. That's probably just never going to happen." Bolzan's wife has tried to help him remember parts of his life since his fall, showing him photographs of key events in his life in hopes of jogging his memory. Along with memories of his personal life, he has lost memories of historical events and basic [[interpersonal relationship]] concepts. He did not understand [[birthday]]s or the relationship between a [[husband]] and [[wife]]. He had no reference points. He did, however, remember basic life tasks, like using [[eating utensil]]s and how to drive a car.{{cite news|url=http://www.kpho.com/news/22861673/detail.html|title=Amnesia Patient Shares Story Of Struggle|first=Cara|last=Liu|publisher=KPHO.com|date=March 16, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110614060245/http://www.kpho.com/news/22861673/detail.html|archivedate=June 14, 2011|df=}} Scott has appeared on talk shows such as Dr. Phil, The View, Fox and Friends, Good Morning America, The Huckabee Show, The Doctors, Nightline, guest appearance on Couples Therapy. Scott has also been a guest on numerous syndicated radio shows and local news stations. The New York Post published an article on October 9, 2011 reporting that a doctor who examined Bolzan after his fall stated that Bolzan was possibly "feigning his alleged memory deficits", explaining that it is questionable that an injury to one part of the brain could affect all the different memories distributed among the organ, while not damaging his cognitive abilities or his ability to form new memories. The article also cited other neurologists who, while having not examined Bolzan, stated that his amnesia violates fundamental knowledge of neurobiology, in that old memories are more resistant to brain damage than recent ones, in contrast to Bolzan's case.{{cite news |title=Memory 'loss' is hi$ gain |first=Susannah |last=Cahalan |authorlink=Susannah Cahalan |url=https://nypost.com/2011/10/09/memory-loss-is-hi-gain/ |newspaper=The New York Post |date=October 9, 2011 |accessdate=September 5, 2013}} ==See also== *[[Clive Wearing]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bolzan, Scott}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:New England Patriots players]] [[Category:Cleveland Browns players]] [[Category:People with traumatic brain injuries]] [[Category:People with amnesia]] [[Category:Northern Illinois Huskies football players]] [[Category:American businesspeople]]

{{one source|date=July 2012}}
[[File:Allgood-Kerrigan 1911.jpg|thumb|Irish actors [[Sara Allgood]] ("Widow Quin") and [[J. M. Kerrigan]] ("Shawn Keogh"), in ''[[The Playboy of the Western World]]'', [[Plymouth Theatre (Boston)|Plymouth Theatre]], Boston, 1911. The play was attacked for replaying the insulting stereotype of the drunken, boasting, belligerent Irishman.]] [[File:Bringing Up Father 1914 play.JPG|thumb|180px|Maggie and Jiggs in a scene from the 1914 play [[Bringing Up Father]].]] '''Stage Irish''' or Paddywhackery is a stereotyped portrayal of [[Irish people]] once common in plays.<ref name="oxford-companion-irish-literature">[https://books.google.com/books?id=vDsAaXKLGvYC&pg=PA534&lpg=PA534&dq=%22stage+Irish%22&source=web&ots=tFER5-skQ-&sig=mJmUMAZ3Bb0NfmfIhbDZvFuHYJ4&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=4&ct=result#PPA533,M1 stage Irishman], ''The Oxford Companion to Irish Literature'', Oxford University Press, p.534-5.</ref> The term refers to an exaggerated or caricatured portrayal of supposed Irish characteristics in speech and behaviour. The stage Irishman was generally "garrulous, boastful, unreliable, hard-drinking, belligerent (though cowardly) and chronically impecunious."<ref name="oxford-companion-irish-literature"/> This caricature includes many cultural outlets, including the stage, Punch cartoons and English language cliché, such as the terms "Paddywagon" and "hooligan." Collectively, this phenomenon is called "Paddywhackery."
The early stage Irish persona arose in England in the context of the war between the [[Jacobitism|Jacobites]] and [[Whig (British political party)|Whig]] supporters of [[William III of England|William of Orange]] at the end of the 17th century. Later, the stage Irish persona become more comic and less threatening. Irish writers also used the persona in a satirical way.
==Early examples== The character of Captain Macmorris in [[Henry V (play)|Henry V]] has been claimed to be the first example of the type.<ref name="oxford-companion-irish-literature"/> His line "What ish my nation?" was later appropriated by modern Irish writers, becoming a "recurrent epigraph".<ref name="oxford-companion-irish-literature"/> However, Macmorris is a loyal and valiant supporter of Henry V, quite different from later, generally lower-class, stage Irishmen. ''Ben Johnson's The Irish Masque at Court'' (29 December 1613; printed 1616) is another early example of the conventions.
James Farewell's poem ''The Irish Hudibras'' (1689) was published in the wake of William's invasion of Ireland to suppress the Jacobite uprising. It is considered to be the principal origin of the stereotype. This takes the form of a parody of book VI of Virgil's [[Aeneid]], in which Aeneas descends into the underworld. In the poem, this is replaced by Fingal in County Dublin, in which Irish costume, behaviour, and speech-patterns are parodied as if they were denizens of Hades. A companion piece, ''Hesperi-Neso-Grapica or A Description of the Western Isle'' by "W.M." was published in 1715. Pamphlets published under the title "Bog witticisms" also parodied the supposed illogicality and stupidity of the Irish.<ref name="oxford-companion-irish-literature"/>
==18th–20th century== Irish characters appeared in a number of plays during the 18th century. These were not all negative stereotypes. Sometimes the Irishman could be a noble, or at least sympathetic character. In others he could outwit others. [[Thomas Sheridan (actor)|Thomas Sheridan]]'s play ''Captain O'Blunder'' is about a naive Irishman who in the end triumphs over his English enemy. Lucius O'Trigger in [[Richard Brinsley Sheridan]]'s ''[[The Rivals]]'' is an excessively quick-tempered individual. The character had to be rewritten because of complaints that it was insultingly anti-Irish. All these characters were from the genteel social classes.
By the 19th century, the stage Irishman became more of a lower-class stereotype, associated with the emigrations of mid-century. [[Dion Boucicault]]'s successful plays ''[[The Colleen Bawn]]'' (1860) and ''[[The Shaughraun]]'' (1874) included several Stage Irish characters.<ref>{{cite book|last1=McFeely|first1=Deirdre|title=Dion Boucicault: Irish Identity on Stage|date=May 2012|publisher=Cambridge University Press|location=Cambridge, UK|isbn=9781139051743|pages=13–28|doi=10.1017/cbo9781139051743.003|url=https://doi.org/10.1017/cbo9781139051743.003|language=en|chapter=Nationalism, Race and Class in ''The Colleen Bawn''}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last1=Kao|first1=Wei H.|title=Contemporary Irish Theatre: Transnational Practices|date=29 December 2015|publisher=Peter Lang B.|isbn=9783035265743|doi=10.3726/978-3-0352-6574-3/6|url=https://doi.org/10.3726/978-3-0352-6574-3/6|language=en|chapter=Remaking the Stage Irishman in the New World: Dion Boucicault’s ''The Shaughraun'', Edward Harrigan’s ''The Mulligan Guard Ball'', and Sebastian Barry’s ''White Woman Street''}}</ref>
Patriotic inversions of the stereotype appeared in Ireland and it was commented upon by writers such as [[George Bernard Shaw]] in [[John Bull's Other Island]] and by [[John Millington Synge]] in ''[[The Playboy of the Western World]]''.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Innes|first1=Christopher|title=A Companion to Irish Literature|date=2010|publisher=Wiley-Blackwell|isbn=9781444328066|pages=35–49|doi=10.1002/9781444328066.ch31|url=https://doi.org/10.1002/9781444328066.ch31|language=en|chapter=Defining Irishness: Bernard Shaw and the Irish Connection on the English Stage}}</ref><ref name="oxford-companion-irish-literature"/> The latter play was condemned by Irish nationalists, including [[Sinn Féin]] leader [[Arthur Griffith]], who described the play as "a vile and inhuman story told in the foulest language we have ever listened to from a public platform", and that it insulted Irish men and women.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Maume|first1=Patrick|title=The Ancient Constitution: Arthur Griffith and His Intellectual Legacy to Sinn Féin|journal=Irish Political Studies|date=1 January 1995|volume=10|issue=1|pages=123–137|doi=10.1080/07907189508406541|url=https://doi.org/10.1080/07907189508406541|issn=0790-7184}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Anti-Irish sentiment]] *[[Minstrel show]] *[[Stereotypes of Irish Americans]]
